page.title: University of WisconsinâMilwaukee School of Freshwater Sciences

revisions.rev:
{{Infobox university |image=<!-- Do NOT place a non-free image here without complying with WP:NFCC #10c --> |name=School of Freshwater Sciences |type = [[Public university|Public]] |established = |dean = David Garman |city =[[Milwaukee]] |state =[[Wisconsin]] |country =[[United States]] |campus =[[University of WisconsinâMilwaukee]] |phone= |website= [http://www4.uwm.edu/freshwater http://www4.uwm.edu/freshwater] |logo=<center>[[Image:UW-Milwaukee.png|150px]]</center> |}} '''University of WisconsinâMilwaukee School of Freshwater Sciences''' ('''SFS''') is an academic division of the [[University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee]] focusing on [[freshwater]] research and graduate education.
Located at the edge of the [[Great Lakes]], SFS is the only graduate school of freshwater science in the U.S. and the third in the world.<ref>[http://www4.uwm.edu/acad_aff/newsevents/sfws_sph_established.cfm Schools of Freshwater Sciences and Public Health Established]</ref><ref>[http://www.jsonline.com/news/education/29429744.html A proposed UWM graduate school could make Milwaukee a global leader in freshwater research], Journal Sentinel</ref><ref>[http://www.nuwireinvestor.com/articles/american-midwest-a-growing-water-investment-hub-53712.aspx American Midwest: A Growing Center For Water Investment], NuWire Investor</ref> It offers Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) and Master of Science (M.S.) of Freshwater Sciences in Freshwater System Dynamics, Human and Ecosystem Health, Freshwater Technology and Freshwater Economics, Policy and Management.<ref>[http://www4.uwm.edu/freshwater/academics/ School of Freshwater Sciences: Academics]</ref>
The school was built upon the [[Great Lakes WATER Institute]], a freshwater research institution of the [[University of Wisconsin System]] administered by the Graduate School of [[University of WisconsinâMilwaukee]].<ref>[http://www.wisconsin.edu/wisconsinideas/archive/dec1999.pdf Great Lakes Water Institute Gives UW Researchers Unique Access to the Study of F resh Waters], Wisconsin Idea, December 1999, Volume 16, No. 3, Page 5.</ref><ref>[http://www.maritimetrails.org/notes/fall2002/thecrew.asp Organizations and Crew], Wisconsin's Maritime Trails</ref>
